FileSystemEntry.summary: The FileSystemEntry interface of the File and Directory Entries API represents a single entry in a file system. The entry can be a file or a directory (directories are represented by the interface). It includes methods for working with files—including copying, moving, removing, and reading files—as well as information about a file it points to—including the file name and its path from the root to the entry.

remarks.para:
-File and Directory Entries API
- and are based on FileSystemEntry.

FileSystemEntryRemove.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's method
remove() deletes the file
or directory from the file system. Directories must be empty before they can be
removed.

remarks.para:
To recursively remove a directory as well as all of its contents and its
subdirectories, call
instead.

FileSystemEntryFilesystem.summary:
The read-only filesystem
property of the interface contains a
object that represents the file system on which the entry
resides.
FileSystemEntryFilesystem.value:
A representing the file system on which the file or directory
described by the FileSystemEntry is located.

FileSystemEntryCopyTo.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's method
copyTo() copies the file
specified by the entry to a new location on the file system.

remarks.para:
There are some
typical restrictions on what you can do:

FileSystemEntryMoveTo.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's method
moveTo() moves the file
specified by the entry to a new location on the file system, or renames the file if
the destination directory is the same as the source.

remarks.para:
There are some typical
restrictions on what you can do:

FileSystemEntryFullPath.summary:
The read-only fullPath property
of the interface returns a string
specifying the full, absolute path from the file system's root to the file represented
by the entry.

remarks.para:
This can also be thought of as a path which is relative to the root directory, with a
"/" prepended to it to make it absolute.

FileSystemEntryFullPath.value: A string indicating the entry's full path.

FileSystemEntryToURL.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's method
toURL() creates and
returns a string containing a URL which can be used to identify the file system entry.
This is done by exposing a new URL scheme—filesystem:—that can be used as
the value of src and href attributes.
FileSystemEntryToURL.returns:
A string containing a URL that can then be used as a document
reference in HTML content, or an empty string if the URL can't be generated (such as if
the file system implementation doesn't support toURL()).

FileSystemEntryIsDirectory.summary:
The read-only isDirectory
property of the interface is true if the
entry represents a directory (meaning it's a )
and false if it's not.

remarks.para:
You can also use to determine if the
entry is a file.

blockquote.para:
You should not assume that any entry which isn't a directory is a file or vice versa.
There are other types of file descriptors on many operating systems. Be sure to use
both isDirectory and isFile as needed to ensure that the
entry is something you know how to work with.

FileSystemEntryIsDirectory.value: A Boolean indicating whether or not the is a directory.

FileSystemEntryGetMetadata.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's method
getMetadata() obtains a
object with information about the file system entry, such as
its modification date and time and its size.

FileSystemEntryName.summary:
The read-only name property of
the interface returns a string
specifying the entry's name; this is the entry within its parent directory (the last
component of the path as indicated by the property).
FileSystemEntryName.value: A string indicating the entry's name.

FileSystemEntryIsFile.summary:
The read-only isFile property of
the interface is true if the entry
represents a file (meaning it's a ) and
false if it's not.

remarks.para:
You can also use to determine
if the entry is a directory.

blockquote.para:
You should not assume that any entry which isn't a file is a directory or vice versa.
There are other types of file descriptors on many operating systems. Be sure to use
both isDirectory and isFile as needed to ensure that the
entry is something you know how to work with.

FileSystemEntryIsFile.value: A Boolean indicating whether or not the is a file.

getParent() obtains a
